page.title: 04 FREEHOLDLAND
page.content: Around our school and covering rough -ly half a square mile is the land called{Freeholdland.}The land is main- ly grass but it is covered with many types of wildlife.{Trees}include{Oak, {Ash, Maple, Beech and Horse-Chestnut while the many types of{wild flowers include{speedwell}and{orchids.}Here are also lots of{insects;}the most common we found were{froghoppers}and {ladybirds.}At the nothern end of Free- holdland is a wood called{Snatchwood. Also contained in the area are{two {quarries; the smaller one contains our {school (Pontnewynydd).}The larger one is just above it and is 4 or 5 times larger. Here{limestone}was quarried but this stopped in the 1960's. Much of the original land has had a housing estate caled{Trevethin}built on it. There are also{6 detatched {houses}and a{small farm.
